Blockchain.com is the world's leading software platform for digital assets. Offering the largest production blockchain platform in the world, we share the passion to code, create, and ultimately build an open, accessible and fair financial future, one piece of software at a time.  We are growing the Data Team of our Finance Operations. We are looking for a Data Scientist who is looking to roll up their sleeves to help build the infrastructure and processes that will support growth in a fast, yet controlled manner. job_title: Postdoctoral Associate - PBPK Modeling and Artificial Intelligence in Toxicology
location: 341 Tigert Hall 300 SW 13th St, Gainesville, FL 32611
job_Description: Two positions are available in the department of Environmental and Global Health at the University of Florida to develop and apply physiologically based pharmacokinetic (PBPK) models and artificial intelligence (AI) methods to toxicology and risk assessment in the laboratory of Zhoumeng Lin, Ph.D., Center for Environmental and Human Toxicology, Center for Pharmacometrics and Systems Pharmacology.  Research projects for these positions include: (1) development of physiologically based pharmacokinetic (PBPK) models of drugs, environmental chemicals, and nanoparticles for applications in nanomedicine, animal-derived food safety, and human health risk assessment; (2) collection and meta-analysis of pharmacokinetic and tissue distribution data of nanoparticles in healthy and tumor-bearing animals using machine learning and AI approaches; and (3) integration of PBPK models with AI methods to develop AI-assisted computational approaches to support decision-making in human, animal and environmental health.   Expected Salary:   Commensurate with experience, in conjunction with NIH guidelines, beginning at $53,760.   Minimum Requirements:   A PhD degree in environmental health, biostatistics, epidemiology, toxicology, pharmacometrics, pharmacology, engineering, bioinformatics, or a related field.   Preferred Qualifications:   Prior biostatistical analysis and pharmacokinetic modeling experience using software such as R, Python, MATLAB, Phoenix, MCSim, Monolix, acslX and Berkeley Madonna.   Special Instructions to Applicants:   This position was originally posted under requisition#84202. All previous applicants do not need to reapply.  Candidates should attach a statement of short-term and long-term research and career goals, a current CV, and three professional references with your online application. Application review will begin immediately and continue until the positions are filled.  The final candidates will be required to provide official transcript to the hiring department upon hire. A transcript will not be considered "official" if a designation of "Issued to Student" is visible. Degrees earned from an education institution outside of the United States are required to be evaluated by a professional credentialing service provider approved by National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES), which can be found at http://www.naces.org/  The University of Florida is an Equal Opportunity institution dedicated to building a broadly diverse and inclusive faculty and staff. If an accommodation due to a disability is needed to apply for this position, please call  352-392-2477  or the Florida Relay System at 800-955-8771 (TDD). Searches are conducted in accordance with Florida’s Sunshine Law.   Health Assessment Required:   No

We’re a family of health centers, supported by a family of Associates. We are one of the first successful health center-controlled networks and our success is due largely to our Associates and their commitment to advancing our mission to improve the health status of our communities. Do you want to join an organization that believes in empowering their most precious resource, their Associates? Are you innovative and results driven? HCN is looking for talented, qualified individuals to join our rapidly expanding, first-class team. Position Summary This position is responsible for developing ongoing data specifications, running ongoing data needs, measurement analysis, monitoring and reporting of quality improvement initiatives. Position Responsibilities Serves as lead subject matter expert for all data needs for the Clinical Quality Department. Oversees successful validation and submission of all data requirements for clinical quality initiatives. Supports member health center service requests through Salesforce ticketing system by researching and providing solutions to data-related issues in Practice Analytics. Performs ongoing analysis of UDS, Meaningful Use, PCMH, HEDIS another clinical quality initiatives. Writes, develops, and publishes supplemental UDS reports to support health center reporting needs. Standardizes monitoring and trending of member center clinical quality performance metrics. Identifies areas of opportunity for network and member center performance improvement. Works with internal and external stakeholders to ensure quality standards and data integrity is established and maintained amongst all HCN applications. Provides data build, specification write up, and reports for the following projects (but not limited to) NACHC Quality Improvement Projects Million Hearts Project ECHO FOCUS HRSA Other data-related cooperatives Manages departmental data request forms and backlog of data requests. Collaborates with internal teams on implementing optimal workflows and opportunities to improve performance and efficiency of systems. Actively consults on system upgrade testing and validation process. Serves as the network subject matter specialist on Practice Analytics, including application set up, end user training, report customization and support. Keeps abreast of technological system changes and innovations by maintaining a knowledge base consisting of release notes, system manuals & software enhancements. Performs ad hoc reports as needed. Ability to extract meaning and suggest action items from data, not just report metrics. Ability to articulate principles and concepts of data management and continuous quality improvement to technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to apply basic problem-solving skills. Health Choice Network is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and complies with all federal and state laws, regulations and executive orders regarding affirmative action requirements in all programs. location: 301 W Bay St Ste 2600, Jacksonville, FL 32202
job_Description: About The Energy Authority The Energy Authority is a public power-owned, nonprofit corporation with offices in Jacksonville, Florida and Bellevue (Seattle), Washington. TEA provides public power utilities with access to advanced resources and technology systems so they can respond competitively in the changing energy markets. Through partnership with TEA, utilities benefit from an experienced organization that is singularly focused on deriving the maximum value of their assets from the market. SUMMARY Provides in-depth knowledge and analyses to The Energy Authority’s (TEA) Members and Clients on the value of congestion rights in the relevant RTO markets. Will monitor the appropriate RTO stakeholder groups, FERC and state regulatory filings, market monitor reports, and industry literature regarding current and potential transmission congestion rights markets, transmission planning process, and cost allocation rules within the RTOs in which TEA’s Members and Clients participate. Will assess daily congestion trend and changes in network topology in the relevant RTO markets and revise the relevant models accordingly. Will follow standards used within TEA’s Strategic Innovations & Analytics Department for all analyses around the annual, seasonal, and monthly congestion rights auctions processes. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES  include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Lead analysts to develop models and reports that satisfy Clients requirements Follow an established set of standard procedures used by the Strategic Innovations & Analytics analysts when they are preparing congestion rights (ARR / TCR / FTR / CRR / TCC) recommendations to TEA’s Members and Clients Participate in RTO stakeholder working groups directly related to congestion rights rules and procedures Monitor FERC and relevant state regulatory agencies to understand their existing and proposed rules, tariffs, and processes related to RTO congestion rights Monitor relevant RTO market activities related to transmission studies and congestion rights Have in-depth knowledge of the relevant analytical tools utilized within TEA’s Strategic Innovations & Analytics Department related to transmission analyses and transmission congestion rights; be prepared to use these tools and applications on an as needed basis. These tools and applications may include some or all of the following: Cambridge Energy Solutions’ Dayzer ABB’s PROMOD YES Energy Genscape ABB’s Velocity Suites Transmission powerflow applications such as PSS/E or Powerworld Assist TEA’s staff and the staff of TEA’s Members and clients in the evaluation of transmission plans released by the RTOs Relevant RTO markets include: MISO and PJM SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities. Position is expected to provide mentoring and career development to other analysts as assigned. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Bachelors of Science degree in engineering, mathematics, economics, or other appropriate field of study. Relevant industry experience and/or Master’s Degree is preferred. Five or more years of experience in Analytics fields and Optimization or Data Mining. In-depth knowledge of the Electric Utility Industry. Proficiency with R, Python, and object-oriented programming CERTIFICATES, LICENCES, REGISTRATIONS Professional Engineering License is preferred for candidates with a background in engineering. Certifications such as Certified Financial Analysts, PRIMA or GARP Professional Risk Manager Certification for individuals with financial background is desirable. OTHER SKILLS & ABILITIES Expertise needed with Microsoft Word, Excel/Visual Basic, and other analysis tools. Experience with large utility simulation applications such as PROMOD, Planning and Risk, AuroraXMP, or GEMaps, Dayzer, PSS/e, and PowerWorld is highly desired. Ability to apply techniques of decision analysis, such as decision trees, influence diagrams, etc.

job_title: Data Science Director - Facebook Reality Labs, Assistant
job_Description: We are looking for a seasoned Data Science Director who can navigate the technical complexity of the space and the solutions while also managing and supporting a broad and diverse range of stakeholders. This leader will have a strong product sense, technical and communication skills. Direct experience shipping an intelligent agent or NLP product is highly preferred. You will partner with cross-functional stakeholders (Product, Engineering, Content, Programming, Design) to tackle challenging analytical, statistical, and experimentation problems. The insights that you derive will guide crucial strategic decisions about the future of AI voice products at Facebook. The Data Science team’s mission is to leverage data to understand, identify, and execute, accelerating the journey toward building a novel, powerful, and useful AI voice product for Facebook. Projects our DS work on range from broad user and ecosystem understanding, strategic planning and product goal setting, as well as diving deep on specific applications or the engagement of our users. There are product areas, like Portal and VR, where the Assistant feature is already shipped and we’re continuing to build on that, while there are many other areas like new HW products that are still early in the product development phase. This team is focused on helping the product team scope out new opportunities, define success across the overall product ecosystem and each product area individually, as well as understand how AI voice products can contribute to our mission to increase meaningful connections. This leader will drive the DS team into more experimentation with broad hypothesis areas and determine how we are going to test and then push DS into product development. Given the phase of the products, there’s a lot of testing and pivoting and product re-scoping as we find the right path and product features.    Collaborate with product, engineering and research and other functional experts to shape a shared, data-driven strategic vision for Assistant across the company. Define and shape the north star for driving growth, quality and relevance of our Assistant products and ecosystems. Drive product development with a team of world-class engineers, data scientists, researchers, and other functional experts. Deeply understand the Assistant ecosystem and define and analyze metrics that evaluate our trajectory and inform the success of our products. Translate insights into product direction and empower cross-functional partners to execute in a data-informed manner throughout the entire product life-cycle. Cultivate culture of executional excellence and analytical rigor.    7+ years of experience in managing other team members in a formal capacity and experience managing managers 7+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis 7+ years of experience in an analytical role in technology, hardware, consulting, investment banking, or product management Experience with SQL or other analytic functions and data manipulation in Python or R Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance Experience communicating the results of analysis to influence company and product direction    Masters Degree in Computer Science, Business, Math, Physics, Engineering, or related quantitative field Understanding of statistical analysis, experience with packages, such as Python, R, MATLAB, SPSS, SAS, Stata, etc. Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop/Spark)   Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Essential Job Accountabilities:   Job Summary:  The Quality Data Analyst Senior provides continuous improvement support to the NCH Healthcare Group by functioning as an educator, analyst, facilitator and/or project manager as required. This individual will work throughout the system with a broad range of provider groups to leverage benchmarking and best practices to improve and promote patient and quality care. This position will serve as a facilitator for clinical performance improvement initiatives and guides the development, ongoing review, and implementation of evidence-based guidelines. The guidelines provided by national and medical organizations that provide strategies for health care quality measurement and reporting. Facilitates and supports multidisciplinary teams to achieve clinical performance improvement goals and objectives. This position will have responsibility for educating physicians, healthcare providers, and office staff in clinically approved documentation workflows. Position will identify opportunities for improvement and work closely with the EHR team to incorporate those improvements into the current systems. The Quality Data Analyst Senior will work as a team member with the EHR team, the Billing team, and the ACO project team to assure data entry is accurate and complete. At all times this employee will conduct their work efforts with the ultimate goal of providing high quality, efficient service for the patients and payers of the NCH Healthcare Group.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Facilitates, guides, and supports enterprise, departmental or cross-departmental continuous improvement work as directed by executive leadership. This encompasses preparation and planning for workshops and continued training, implementation and periodic audits of work completed. Serves as a lead to organize and delegate work assignments to quality data analysts. • Produces provider quality scorecards/dashboards and meets with providers to review. Assists leadership to develop proficiency in continuous improvement methodologies and approaches. Provides ongoing improvement training as well as serving as an educational resource. Participates in tactical planning for the continuous improvement work to be done in conjunction with numerous local and national healthcare organizations. Develops, maintains and revises work plans as appropriate and monitors outcomes. Integrates work with other departmental initiatives and revises as needed. Contributes to the development and promotion of standard work across the organization. Promotes the attainment of national goals through continued education. Works hand and hand with the EHR team in further development of the existing EHR systems in an effort to ensure the best patient quality care in line with national standards.  Continually tracks and regularly provides management/leadership updates as to the status of these goals. Including not limited to Meaningful Use, PQRS, and Quality Metrics, future metrics.   Education, Experience, Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree in Healthcare, Finance, IT, Quality or related field.  Minimum of 3 years of experience in a related field. Experience using PC applications such as MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.  Comprehensive knowledge of medical diagnostic & procedural terminology is required. Ability to work w/ & maintain confidentially of physician, patient accounts & personal data. Knowledge of outpatient coding practices at both clinical & inpatient settings. Required knowledge of compliance & regulatory requirements including outpatient CMS regulations. Strong interpersonal & excellent written, verbal & presentation skills. Possess a strong attention to detail, a personal commitment to accuracy and excellence, excellent communications and interpersonal and organization skills.  Prioritize workload & meet deadlines. Ability to read & interpret medical data.  Flexible depending upon department and/or physician schedule needs.  Review analytical data & audit findings to identify coding trends & other risk areas.  Develop data requirements & work w/analytical groups to extract, organize & analyze coded data. Clinical or Coding background.  A strong interest in measurement and statistics. Location: NCH Healthcare System · NCH ACO Schedule: Full-Time, Day, 0800-1630

Company Overview:  At ADT, we've been in the business of helping save lives for more than 145 years. As the number one smart home security provider serving residential and business customers, our people are our most important asset. Headquartered in Boca Raton, FL and at more than 200 locations across North America, our employees help empower our customers to live more secure and confident lives. Join our team and help us protect what matters most. For more information, visit www.adt.com or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram.  Position Summary: This position is responsible for providing thought leadership on execution of strategic analytics initiatives, people data modeling and experimentation to solve essential business and HR challenges with a focus on key issues such as predicting great hires, employees at risk of leaving, and supporting our company's employee engagement and diversity and inclusion goals and objectives. Additional responsibilities will encompass quantitative analytics, predictive modeling, research design, consulting, and soft skills applicable to people research. This position will have direct involvement in operationalizing our people strategy with our analytics team to solve complex human and data questions and communicating solutions that provide insights and lead to data-driven recommendations. The successful person in this role will be forward-thinking–a committed supporter for predictive analytics and enjoy constantly learning and growing skills within people analytics and data science. This position will work directly with the People Analytics Leader, as well as data analysts, data engineers, and HR Business Partners.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES include the following. To perform this job successfully, the Data Scientist, People Analytics may be expected to perform special projects and other duties as requested. Seek to understand people-related business problems and help frame them into actual research questions that can be answered with data. Bring together our organization's data, as well as external data and research, to help our business leaders understand and act on people issues. Translate data and insights into meaningful visualizations and stories to drive strategy, action, and decision-making at executive levels, within HR, and with people managers. Deliver strong customer service including translation of requests into requirements and communication of technical information to a non-technical audience. Use platforms, programming, and systems to establish single-source data to be leveraged across the business to support insights and improved decision-making. Lead data-driven and evidence-based research to support the delivery of people metrics, reporting, and advanced and predictive analytics. Align research priorities with business priorities and take a customer-focused mindset in working with stakeholders. Leverage expertise and knowledge of HR industry and people analytics trends to address practical business challenges. Collaborate with and communicate broadly within the People Analytics team, HR, and the business in a cross-functional effort with key stakeholders to identify key initiatives and execute delivery of sustainable solutions to expand our data universe. Exercise traits of adaptability and good judgment to support organizational agility. Be a constant learner, active listener, and teacher to advance data science, people analytics, and our organization. Exude passion for your field, people analytics, and our organization both internally and externally to establish us as thoughtful and effective use of data and people analytics.  CORE COMPETENCIES:  Experience in research design, visualization techniques, and analysis approaches in which you manage and analyze both structured and unstructured data. Experience in advanced statistical methods around hypothesis testing, clustering, machine learning predictions, and text mining. Experience modeling high-dimensional data. Experience with tools and languages such as SQL, R, Python, Tableau, and in the design and implementation of data pipelines that support the continuous delivery of insight. Understanding of the external people analytics landscape and trends. Ideally experience with people research, the human capital domain, user interface, consulting, and our industry. Experience in applying data privacy regulations and navigating how to effectively use data while protecting an individual's privacy. Experience in thriving in project environments that often start with uncertain requirements or outcomes; ability to apply definition and structure around uncertain problems. Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment and the versatility to manage multiple projects, priorities, and urgent issues successfully and simultaneously Experience in positively interacting with people of opposing thoughts and ideas within a team environment.  EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION :  Four (4) year degree or equivalent experience required in either Analytics, Mathematics, Operations or Computer Science, Statistics, or similar highly quantitative degree.  WORK EXPERIENCE:  3+ year's directly applicable experience in data modeling and data tools and languages such as Python required.  ADT LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We are committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce and do our best to foster a culture and environment where every employee feels valued. Our goal is to serve our customers and help save lives. We can achieve this goal when we have the best talent working in an environment where employees feel included and recognized. Visit us online at jobs.adt.com to learn more.

When you join Verizon  Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here. What you’ll be doing...  As a Machine Learning (ML) Product Manager within the Platforms and Ecosystems (P&E) organization, you will work within the NBx Decisioning ecosystem to manage the delivery of probabilistic assets that predict, prescribe, and optimize the experiences being served to customers. Act as a consultant to experience owners to determine their needs, and whether those needs are a fit for an ML-driven solution. If they are, you will provide your expertise to guide the design of the end user solution to best fit an ML-driven product. Once the end user solution is defined, you will work with the Data Science and ML Engineering teams as they deliver the ML product, and ensure the product that is delivered meets the needs of the end user solution. Finally, you help analyze and monitor the performance of the model and end user solution, iterating on the ML product as necessary to optimize performance. What we’re looking for...  You know how to influence up, down, and across groups, and you take satisfaction in mentoring others. You understand Machine Learning concepts and how they can be applied to provide the best experiences for customers. You know what it takes to move work forward, anticipating hurdles and overcoming them. You believe that collaboration and teamwork leads to the best results, and you know how to work as part of a team. You’ll need to have: Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Working knowledge of Machine Learning and Data Science principles. Experience delivering software products, either as a product owner, product manager, or engineer. Willingness to travel. Even better if you have: Degree in mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering, computer science, or economics. ML or Pega certifications Experience with building machine learning models. Experience with probabilistic optimization and analytics. Experience managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders. Working knowledge of PEGA CDH. Responsibilities: Job Summary: The Director, Data Science and Machine Learning facilitates data-driven decisions throughout the company by designing automated deep-learning systems, building advanced predictive models, providing valuable strategic insights, architecting outcome-oriented data storage, and democratizing access to data science processes across the organization. This role will build a team of data scientists that use programming languages and statistical methods to provide prescriptive insight into business performance, and effectively communicates findings and strategic opportunities uncovered by the analysis. Operating as an internal consultant, this role regularly delivers innovative analysis and strategic recommendations to the highest levels of leadership in the company. Leads process or decisions that impact the overall organization. Building a data science team that provides innovative and insightful analysis on issues affecting the airline by bringing together data from across the organization, utilizing advanced programming and statistical modeling techniques. Drives the adoption of predictive analytics across the business, in both automated decision-making conditions and in larger strategic decisions. Works on the end-to-end data science pipeline: from data collection and cleaning, to experimenting with predictive models, to deployment of the results. Assesses data needs for project-specific outcomes and builds frameworks for lasting data architecture to exist after project completion. Coordinates with our Business Intelligence team to deploy new architecture. Collaborates with Business Intelligence leadership to leverage existing data pipelines and models for analytics and to transform insights into applied models for optimal decision-making Designs machine learning models to automate a variety of operational conditions, and maintains these models through routine review. Develops scenario-based simulation models for understanding the impact of changes to business planning, including scheduling, overbooking, connection efficiency, fuel burn, crew allocation, and more. Works with stakeholders to understand real-world context and translates those learnings to data conditions and hypotheses. Stay up to date on the latest industry trends as they relate to technology, methods, strategy and data. May perform other responsibilities as assigned. Responsibilities and duties may change when circumstances dictate (e.g., emergencies change in workload, rush jobs or technical developments). Qualifications: Bachelors Degree Master's degree preferred (Quantitative – Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Math, Data, and or related field). 7-10 years of experience Demonstrated working knowledge of SQL, and an understanding of AZURE. Working knowledge of Python and R. Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to translate broad strategies into specific objectives and action plans. Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving skills and exhibits comfort with ambiguity.  Possess strong presentation skills and expertise in designing effective charts, graphs, and visualizations. Able to distill complex ideas into easy-to-understand concepts for fellow Team Members to comprehend.  Have knowledge of latest technology trends, tools, and techniques.  Strong business acumen and application of data science and machine learning to business strategy.  Experience managing staff, including responsibility for project assignments and performance evaluation. Additional Competencies Able to strategize and conceptualize on the highest levels, teach Team Members the how and why of data science work, and directly help with the tactical and functional execution of day-to-day tasks. Generates creative solutions; Translates concepts and information into images; Uses feedback to modify designs; Applies design principles; Demonstrates attention to detail.  Views problem solving through the eyes of internal and external Guests; Aims to “WOW” stakeholders by exceeding expectations on service. Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics. Develops project plans; Coordinates projects; Communicates changes and progress; Completes projects on time and budget; Manages project team activities.  Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.  Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.  Writes clearly and informatively; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information; Excellent communicator, Able to present at all levels. *Please be advised that you will be asked to complete a required assessment to be considered for this position. This assessment will be emailed to you after you apply. Please be sure to check your Spam folder and/or junk mail if you do not receive it. * We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits to our team members including medical, dental, STD, LTD, life insurance, 401(k), paid time off, travel benefits and much more. We strive to maintain a professional, yet friendly environment and promote professional and career development for our Team Members. JOB OVERVIEW: The Sr. Business Data Analyst uses data to create business value for finance, operations, marketing, HR, and other functions. This is a decision support role that will consult with business partners to identify the business problem, find relevant data sources, prepare data, perform analysis, and present insights. Projects can be ad hoc analysis, automated processes, or dashboards. This individual will also partner with data science, engineering, and business intelligence to create production analytics products. This person must have a passion for learning, data, and problem solving.   ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Ask great questions and develop many hypotheses for each business problem Test hypotheses using appropriate data, statistics, and analytic tools Automate repeatable processes Make relevant data visualizations or dashboards Know and understand data available at Darden Consult with business partners on data and business problems and develop solutions Perform financial analysis and ROI to estimate impact of analytic solutions Create readable, repeatable workflows or code Continually learn and share your knowledge liberally Maintain automated processes Train and mentor analysts with less experience   REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS: Three to five years of experience in analytics Knowledge of relational data and moderate experience with SQL Knowledge of statistics Strong problem solving and logic skills Proficient in data analysis and analytics tools (Alteryx or R/Python) Experience in data preparation and automation for dashboarding Proficient in visualization, dashboard design, and associated tools (Power BI, Tableau) Strong business acumen Strong project management skills Strong communication skills both written and verbal Ability to complete projects and produce great work in a timely manner   REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree   OTHER KEY QUALIFICATIONS: Work well on a team Ability to work independently Extremely curious about data Strong desire to learn new analytic techniques and get better every day   PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: Graduate degree in technical field Experience with Alteryx, Power BI, Snowflake, Databricks Experience in marketing analysis, A/B testing, Design of Experiments Knowledge of restaurant industry

Duties and Responsibilities Manages datasets and ensures data quality (data cleaning); combines, organizes, and cleans data collected. Performs inferential analyses, including regression, ANOVA, factor analysis, IRT modeling, longitudinal data analysis, mixed modeling, and structural equation modeling. Performs descriptive analyses, such as means, variances, covariances/correlations, and frequencies. Summarizes statistical results by creating graphs, tables, and charts for presentation to leadership. Serves as technical resource for concept development by developing concept logic, testing and analyzing the results, and providing recommendations to improve the outcome. Identifies action from predictive and prescriptive results. Tracks trends in data and measures success of actions. Responsible for custom Suncoast Credit Union analytics, including the SunLogix, solution. This includes creating, maintaining, and troubleshooting models, lift charts, etc. Writes, reviews, and maintains documentation describing all elements of data warehouse and cube design (including standards, functionality, logic, deployment and implementation procedures, time estimates, and test plans). Maintains knowledge and understanding of current trends, laws, and issues affecting area of expertise. Attends educational events that will increase professional knowledge and be otherwise beneficial to the Credit Union. Completes annual BSA/AML Compliance Training and understands employee’s role in maintaining an effective BSA/AML compliance program, and completes FACT Act Red Flag training. Minimum Education, Experience, and Skill Requirements Bachelor’s degree in advanced Mathematics, Applied Statistics, Quantitative Measurement, or other quantitative analysis discipline. Master’s degree in one of these same fields preferred. 5 years progressively responsible experience in data analysis and data extraction, preferably with a financial institution. Experience working with MS Excel pivot tables, MS Access, SQL, SPS Statistics, or other statistical software. Able to prioritize tasks, deal effectively with competing and changing priorities, and meet deadlines. Accurate, detail-oriented, and organized. Able to analyze and resolve difficult and sometimes complex problems and situations. Strong knowledge and understanding of Credit Union products, services, policies, and procedures pertinent to the job. Strong knowledge and understanding of regulatory compliance necessary to successfully perform job responsibilities. Strong knowledge and understanding of all Credit Union computer systems and software applications required to perform job duties. Strong verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills in order to interact professionally and effectively with members, staff, vendors, and government regulators. Able to influence others regarding policies, practices, and procedures. Works independently with limited supervision. Technical Focus: Maintaining up-to-date knowledge within one's field of expertise; Applying technical skills and knowledge. Attention to Detail: Taking responsibility for a thorough and detailed method of working. Member Focus: Giving high priority to customer satisfaction and customer service; Anticipating member/business needs and acting accordingly. Self Management: Manages own time, priorities, and resources to achieve goals. Adaptability: Maintaining effectiveness in reaching set goals by adapting to changed circumstances, tasks, responsibilities, and people; adjusting one's own behavior in light of changing conditions. Communication: Shaping communication to the needs of the audience; conveying ideas and opinions clearly to others; listening attentively to others; using appropriate grammar and vocabulary. Conceptual Thinking: Understanding a given situation or problem by combining information that is readily available; identifying patterns or connections between situations that are not obviously related; identifying key or underlying issues in complex situations. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, employee is regularly required to sit, stand, and walk; use hands and fingers to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Must be able to lift and carry up to 25 pounds. Vision requirements include close and classroom vision. Periodically required to travel by automobile. Overnight travel periodically required. Periodically required to work other than normal business hours. Disclaimer Read Only Text This job description is not intended to be all inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the on-going needs of the Credit Union.

Ethicon Supply Chain is recruiting a  Data Science Leader  located in Raritan, NJ, or another J&J site in North America. This leader will connect data science practitioners throughout the Ethicon supply chain and the enterprise Digital & Data Science organization to drive new levels of business performance from digital solutions. They will provide overall data science expertise from our center of excellence on myriad data science projects prioritized across the franchise. This individual will be a key leader within the Digital and Data Science Excellence team reporting to the Digital Transformation Director and they will be a member of both the Ethicon supply chain Digital Council and Steering Committee. The Data Science Leader will focus on several key areas supporting our digital transformation. They will partner with business leaders to identify and cultivate applications of data science to new and existing supply chain opportunities. They will design and deploy models and solutions that drive value both directly and through collaboration with internal and external experts. They will coach and mentor other data scientists and our growing ranks of citizen data scientists across the global organization. Major Duties & Responsibilities:  Provide data science support to the portfolio of projects delivering novel modeling solutions designed to drive the interrogation of datasets for insights in business application areas. Oversee the development of predictive models and computational methods to guide and influence decision-making outcomes.  Translate unstructured, complex business problems into the appropriate data problems, data models, and analytical solutions across multiple projects. Solutions include the application of specialized approaches in classification, regression, clustering, NLP, image analysis, graph theory, and/or other techniques.  Liaise with experts from the enterprise Digital & Data Science organization as well as external consultants to coordinate the development of digital solutions.  Manage partnerships with third-party academic or industry experts to shape and drive project outcomes and build organizational knowledge.  Advise supply chain leadership with insights and recommendations based on expertise, trends, benchmarks, etc. Provide thought leadership describing the art of the possible to influence and shape supply chain strategy and our digital transformation roadmap.  Lead, coach, and mentor a team of data scientists and digital subject matter experts across the organization.  Advance data science expertise and best practices across the organization, leading a center of practice and advising on training curricula for citizen data scientists and digital translators. Additional responsibilities to lead and support aspects of the franchise supply chain digital transformation as a member of the Digital and Data Science Excellence team to be determined as the model matures.   Qualifications Required Qualifications:  A Bachelor’s degree is required and a focus in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or another technical major is preferred  A minimum of 7 years of related experience including supply chain experience  Deep knowledge and strong technical competence in machine learning, statistics, data mining or related field  Project management experience  Demonstrated expertise in bridging technical and business disciplines and hands-on experience with the operationalization of advanced machine learning analytics with a track record of success and proven outcomes  Solid understanding of BI and data solutions, including Power Pivot, cubes, data warehouse, and data marts  Strong leadership experience with the ability to develop and lead diverse, cross-functional global teams  Ability to understand, shape, and measure the business value of solutions, while managing competing stakeholder priorities and ambiguity  Experience collaborating with multi-disciplinary teams  Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex methods and results to diverse audiences  Up to 25% travel may be required  Preferred Qualifications  MS in Operations Research, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Quantitative MBA Experience working in the Agile Project Management methodology  Experience with data visualization and presentation (Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, etc.) is preferred Overview: WiredPeople is seeking to hire three bioinformaticians to help support surveillance activities for pathogens of public health concern in Florida. The bioinformaticians will work directly with the Lead Bioinformatician to expand and support bioinformatics capacity in Florida and for the CDC AMD Southeast Region. This opportunity will require relocation to Jacksonville, FL. We are hiring for three levels of bioinformatician roles: Bioinformatician – Developer Bioinformatician – Training Lead Bioinformatician – Molecular Epidemiologist All roles will work alongside public health stakeholders in Jacksonville, Florida. Responsibilities:  (Primary responsibilities for each position are indicated below; however, each position may provide some support in all areas, as needed). Support next-generation sequencing (NGS) analysis and molecular surveillance of bacterial and viral pathogens of public health interest in Florida. (Developer) Develop, maintain, and update bioinformatics pipelines for NGS analysis. Review and submit genomic data to the relevant public genomic databases. (Developer) Develop customized data visualizations for genomic surveillance activities (e.g., using tools such as Nextstrain or other dashboards). Share and present genomic surveillance data to public health laboratory leadership, epidemiologists, and other state and national public health officials. Provide analytical support to research projects with government and academic partners. Provide training support to other state partners in the AMD Southeast Region related to WGS data analysis. This may include providing training through virtual office hours or webinars. (Molecular Epidemiologist) Work directly with epidemiologists to provide molecular epidemiology support for NGS surveillance activities for bacterial and viral pathogens. (Molecular Epidemiologist) Provide training to epidemiologists and other non-laboratory public health officials for NGS-related surveillance activities. (Training Lead) Develop all training materials, including written protocols, recorded training videos, and webinars over various bioinformatics topics. (Training Lead) Plan, organize and lead an annual bioinformatics workforce development training workshop provided to AMD Southeast Region jurisdictions. Qualifications and Experience Required: Masters or PhD in bioinformatics, genetics, microbiology, molecular biology, computer science, or related field. (Developer and Molecular Epi positions) At least two years of bioinformatics experience with microbiology and/or public health applications. Experience working in a UNIX/LINUX environment and writing shell scripts. Experience developing custom scripts and pipelines using standard bioinformatics tools for microbial genomics. Proficiency in at least one scripting/programming language (e.g., Python, Perl, R, C++, Java) and willingness to learn new languages, if necessary. Experience using and submitting genomic data to NCBI databases. Excellent written and verbal communication and experience publishing relevant scientific literature. Preferred: Experience with high-performance computing (HPC). Experience with or knowledge of Singularity or Docker. Experience using git/github. (Developer) Experience developing workflows using a workflow language (such as Snakemake or Nextflow). Experience with pathogen genomics, including SARS-CoV-2 genomics. (Developer) Experience (or interest in) building dashboards for displaying sequencing data. (Training Lead) Experience teaching or tutoring genetics, bioinformatics, molecular biology, or related subject area.  TawdazXDy2

Our tradition of delivering innovative, technical solutions dates back to 1995, however, you may know us better by one of our legacy company names: Trident Technologies, Smartronix, Datastrong or C2S Consulting Group. With the support of OceanSound Partners, our private equity investment sponsor, we began operating as one business starting in 2019 and became SMX in 2021. We operate in close proximity to our clients around the globe and have core locations in Alabama, California, DC Metro, Florida, Hawaii, Maryland, and Massachusetts.  Today, as SMX, we are one team and together empower government and commercial enterprises to become more effective, innovative, and resilient, no matter what challenges they face. Smartronix is seeking an inquisitive and adaptable Senior Data Analyst, with a Department of Defense secret security clearance, to  join our team in sunny Key West!  As a Smartronix Data Analyst, you will quickly learn and understand the United States Southern Command (SOUTHCOM) operational and business needs, as well as data across multiple subordinate commands and systems. The ideal candidate will operate in a highly collaborative environment and will effectively work and communicate within SOUTHCOM, JIATF-S and as well as the user community, to understand the mission and operating systems. The Data Analyst will use data from multiple projects and sources to determine the Return on Investment (ROI) of such programs, which will be reported up to command leadership. The ideal candidate will understand how to develop and modify dashboards based on provided requirements to achieve desired results.  The best candidate for this position will be capable of decisive action and grounded in a strong analytical and creative approach to mastering challenges.    Essential Duties & Responsibilities   Review raw data contained in operational logs and identify relevant data elements to be extracted to inform on Return on Investment(ROI)  Review historical JOC logs to extract and populate the CN Database built by Praevius  Return on Investment (ROI) analysis and reporting  Conduct Quality control checks of JOC information that gets loaded into the CN Database  Develop an enduring cost-tracking methodology, accepted widely across the enterprise, to inform the investment tracking of the Return-on-Investment framework  Assist in the development of requirements enabling wider acceptance and deeper utility of the CN ROI dashboard  Develop and maintain a library of reports/ dashboards/ scorecards and prepare reports, tables, graphs  Identify and make recommendations on trends in data discrepancies and executes steps to reconcile data  Oversee the training of JOC personnel and implementation of process improvements within the JOC to improve the accuracy and efficiency of CN Database inputs  Establish credibility and foster cooperation between the HQ and JIATFS   Knowledge, Skills & Abilities   Required Clearance: Secret  Ability to obtain TS clearance  Must be comfortable working in a dynamic environment with several ongoing concurrent projects; able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively  Process-oriented with the ability to understand and reengineer existing business processes and recommend new processes and procedures  Strong analytical and financial capabilities  Advanced Excel skills and experience in cost analysis  Strong testing skills with a high attention to detail for accuracy  Ability to develop dashboards and train personnel on dashboard development  Experience developing Return on Investment reports based on reviewing raw data and cost  Working knowledge of database design and data engineering fundamentals  Experience developing and implementing operating and business processes and procedures     Education & Experience   5+ years of experience in processing large volumes and variety of data (Structured and unstructured data, writing code for parallel processing)  Bachelor's in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance (or equivalent degree) required   Vaccination is a requirement of the position per Executive Order 14042. If a candidate is not vaccinated, they may request an accommodation once offered the position. The accommodation must be granted prior to the employee starting in the position. Candidate will have 60 days to get vaccinated.  #cjpost #LI-DD1 SMX is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability status, protected veteran status, race, color, age, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or genetic information. Selected applicant will be subject to a background investigation. SMX is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.

job_title: Back End Software Developer - Machine Learning
location: Tampa City Center 201 North Franklin Street Suite 3600, Tampa, FL 33602
job_Description: In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI).  Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.   Work you'll do    Lead the development of major features and implementations, including helping to design the architecture for those features. Complete coding, testing, documenting, and helping to ensure successful deployment of that code. Review pull requests from other engineers, pair programming, and other collaborative work. Work on process, architecture, implementation, and quality of the product. Troubleshoot issues in a timely manner to ensure the stability of the platform and our client implementations.    The team  Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.  The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients.  Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers.  Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.   Requirements:   2+ years of experience back -end development 2+ years of JavaScript experience 2+ years of experience with at least one server-side language (preferably Java or Node.js) 2+ years of experience with Django or Flask and solid Python skills 2+ years of experience with agile software development Bachelor's degree US Citizenship Must have a Secret Level Clearance or higher    Preferred:    Prior professional services or federal consulting experience Ability to work with both technical and functional resources Affinity for learning new technology and create problem solving with it  How you'll grow  At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn.  We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

job_title: Endowed Professorship (Open Rank), Statistics and Data Science
job_Description: Job no:  500766  Work type:  Faculty  Location:  Main Campus (Orlando)  Categories:  Sciences   Classification Title:  Endowed Professorship (Open Rank), Statistics and Data Science   Administrative Title:  No Administrative Function   Job Description:  The Department of Statistics and Data Science at the University of Central Florida (UCF) invites applications for a 9-month, tenure-track or tenured endowed professorship position (open rank), anticipated to begin August 2022. The position will carry a rank commensurate with the candidate’s demonstrated record of teaching, research and service.   We seek faculty candidates with a background in statistical learning, artificial intelligence, or machine learning. The successful applicant must have a strong record in research that is commensurate with a tenure-track or tenured position in the Department of Statistics and Data Science at UCF.   Furthermore, the ideal candidate will be an excellent mentor who can help students master both the theoretical and practical skills needed for success in this highly interdisciplinary field. We are especially interested in an individual who can lead the effort to build a nationally recognized big data research program. The selected candidate should also contribute through their research, teaching, and service to the diversity and excellence of our academic community to foster an environment in which faculty, staff, and students from a variety of backgrounds, cultures, and personal experiences are welcomed and can thrive.   The Department of Statistics and Data Science at UCF is dedicated to high-caliber research at the intersection of statistics, statistical machine learning, deep learning, data mining, computer science, and applied mathematics, and to developing the statistical and analytical abilities of students that are necessary in an increasingly data-driven world. The Ph.D. program in Big Data Analytics offered by the department is the first of its kind in Florida, and one of only a few programs globally, that trains students and researchers to tackle the scale and complexity of real-world datasets encountered in contemporary industrial and academic settings. In addition to the Ph.D. in Big Data Analytics, the department offers two undergraduate degrees, one in Statistics and one in Actuarial Science; an M.S. degree with two tracks in Data Science and Statistics, and an SAS Data Mining Certificate program. In 2021, the department is expected to launch a joint B.S. degree program in Data Science between the College of Sciences (COS) and the College of Engineering and Computer Science (CECS). For more information, visit https://sciences.ucf.edu/statistics/.   The College of Sciences houses most of the university’s natural, computational, and social sciences in eight departments, two schools, and several centers. The college’s programs play a key role in advancing UCF as a national research university that is determined to help students from all backgrounds achieve success. For more information, visit https://sciences.ucf.edu/.   UCF, located in Orlando, Florida, is classified as a Very High Research Activity university by the Carnegie Foundation. With a diverse student body of more than 72,000 students, UCF is one of the largest universities in the country. The university offers more than 200-degree programs. UCF is committed to diversity and is designated as a Hispanic Serving Institution. For more information, visit http://www.ucf.edu.   Department:  AA-College of Sciences, Department of Statistics and Data Science   Type of Appointment:  Regular   Advertised Annual Salary:  Negotiable   Minimum Qualifications:  A doctorate in Statistics, Data Science, or a closely related field from an accredited institution is required.   In order to obtain tenure, the selected candidate must have a demonstrated record of teaching, research and service commensurate with rank.   Preferred Qualifications:  Preference will be given to candidates who have a strong record of funding, extensive experience in mentoring/supervising Ph.D. students, and have made outstanding contributions in the areas of data science, big data analytics, statistics, high-dimensional data analysis, machine learning, and/or deep learning and have a willingness to teach courses in these areas.   Special Instructions to Applicants:   Additional Application Materials Required:  UCF requires all applications and supporting documents to be submitted electronically through the Human Resources website, https://www.ucf.edu/jobs/. In addition to the online application, interested candidates should upload the following: a CV, a letter of interest, and statements of research and teaching. The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. job_title: Data Scientist - Fort Myers, FL based - Relocation Assistance Provided!
job_Description: With approximately 1,300 boutiques and outlets throughout the U.S., as well as an online presence for each of our brands, it takes sophisticated technology, resources and infrastructure to ensure the continued success of our businesses. From finance and accounting to technology and merchandising careers, we have diverse opportunities available for talented professionals to join our team of nearly 16,000 associates who share our commitment to excellence.  POSITION OBJECTIVE: This position is responsible for planning and managing projects across all analytics areas – descriptive, predictive, prescriptive, and cognitive – as needed by the various business functions. It requires the application of consistent and rigorous statistical analysis, and the effective articulation of results to management and business analysts to support scientific decision-making.  FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using Big Data techniques. Conduct data mining using state-of-the-art methods to drive optimization and improvement of marketing techniques and business strategies. Work with peers to enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems. Create automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of performance. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Build closed-loop algorithms to power scaled personalization within the digital experience. Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes. Work cross-functionally to gather insights which will improve marketing efforts. Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Keep up-to-date with latest technology trends and how to best leverage machine learning, neural networks and other avenues to harness the power of the organizations vast data. This position may be found in multiple departments. Some duties may vary from department to department.  COMPETENCIES : Culture Living the Chico's FAS Values and Guiding Principles by demonstrating Customer focus, instilling trust, driving engagement, and driving results. Decision Quality Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward. Action Oriented Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. Interpersonal Savvy Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people. Situational Adaptability Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations.  QUALIFICATIONS : Bachelor’s degree preferred, in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field preferred; Master’s Degree a plus 5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models Proficiency in R, Python, or both Familiarity with SQL Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Decision Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc. Experience in the retail industry a plus Strong Microsoft Office skills Certificate in business analytics, data mining, or statistical analysis preferred Preferred Qualification 5+ years’ experience in analytics or data science - with an emphasis in customer analytics and marketing analytics; forecasting; structural equations, marketing ROI and attribution, building predictive models and multivariate techniques, working in environments with disparate data sources Chico’s FAS, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, lactation, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, military service, veteran status, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law. Apply Now

Description & Requirements WHAT MAKES US A GREAT PLACE TO WORK We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 12 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents. WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH This is an opportunity to be a key member of Bain’s expanding advanced analytics capability area. This position will be part of the Advanced Analytics Group (Bain’s team of advanced analytics experts). The role will involve advising on the application of industrial analytics, data science, simulation, and optimization to solve clients’ challenges, with a focus on the mining sector; leading the implementation of Operations Research and/or Industrial Analytics techniques within the Advanced Analytics Group in Asia Pacific; and coaching clients and client-facing consultants on implementation, interpretation, and communication of solutions Applications will be broad and global, but with a focus on APAC. These could include industrial analytics, supply chain and logistics, resource planning, manufacturing and retail, network and service operations, and marketing and sales. The successful applicant will be flexible and able to translate learnings from one use case / industry to another.   WHAT YOU'LL DO Apply best practice statistical, simulation and prescriptive analytics to mining, manufacturing and operations problems Willing to train on the broader range of Advanced Statistical toolkit as needed in order to support full range of client needs (e.g. customer and marketing analytics, data sciences, etc.) Work with Bain consultants and Advanced Analytics experts to clarify and define business objectives and identify practical value-added analytics solutions Develop data requirements and analytics plan to fit time, tool and budget considerations Implement, evaluate and validate algorithms, statistical processes, and optimization and simulation models Apply existing experience in analytics and the mining sector to new and novel client situations – e.g., predictive maintenance, process control or control automation Identify and communicate insights; model processes and functions; limitations and risks. Assist client-facing consultants in developing recommendations Advise or build visualization and decision support tools to facilitate use of algorithms by clients in day to day and strategic decisions after Bain projects end Lead a small team of more junior data scientists with general statistical or data science qualifications, to deliver best-practice implementation of analytic solutions in the mining sector Stay abreast of developments in the field and continue to advance Bain capabilities to serve clients. Identify trends in Data Science and Digital that will impact Bain and AAG work and help bring those perspectives to the AAG team and Practice leaders   ABOUT YOU Ph.D. or Masters in Operations Research, Industrial Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or other quantitative field 8+ years experience as a data scientist 5+ years experience in mining, oil & gas or related industry in a business context Experience delivering mining-related use cases such as predictive maintenance, process optimization or control automation Experience with data presentation, dashboarding or visualization tools such as Tableau Experience leading multiple reports to deliver large/complex projects that delivered tangible results Proven track record of developing and deploying solutions for a production-ready recommendation, including working with big data tools (e.g., PySpark) to create scalable solutions Must either be based in Australia, or willing to travel as needed (Occasionally up to 4 days per week, but significantly less on average) Prior experience in consulting preferred but not required

Job Description Summary: Under the direction of the Senior Director of Informatics, the Data Scientist (DS) will be transformational in bringing data analytics and Data as a Service (DaaS) to Florida Cancer Specialists. The Data Scientist possesses deep oncology expertise combined with statistical data knowledge to develop Florida Cancer Specialists data platform to further cancer research. The Data Scientist works cross functionally with the ‘trusted data’ and DaaS teams to provide guidance as to the type, cleanliness and level of data granularity needs for artificial intelligence and machine learning inputs. A Data Scientist is responsible for mining cancer related data to create concepts that can be presented in Florida Cancer Specialists (FCS) data platform. As a Data Scientist you will be engaged in data modeling, data mining and statistical analysis to deliver meaningful information to business users, researchers, clinicians and patients. A Data Scientist assists the Informatics team in inspecting all phases of the data maturity process. The role of a Data Scientist involves the development and consultation to deliver highly dimension data intensive concepts. To thrive on the FCS Informatics team the Data Scientist must be an active contributor in a cross-functional entrepreneurial agile scrum environment to deliver agile analytics. Position Qualifications/Requirements Education  : Ph.D. in a technical, scientific or quantitative field preferred Master’s degree in business analytics, computer science, engineering, accounting, finance, management information systems or another related field. In lieu of degree, 10+ years of experience is required or the equivalent combination for education and experience. Certifications/Licenses  : Valid state Driver’s License for travel to satellite offices and offsite meetings. Compliance with the company Driver Safety Operations and Motor Vehicle Records Check Policy is required. Previous Experience 5+ years’ experience in a healthcare setting and familiarity with pathology and oncology data and medical records Technical competencies within data modeler, SQL to create/maintain DB objects, query/load required data using data governance and visualization tools. Proven understanding of how to examine data from multiple disparate sources to create relationships, patterns, associations and other factors that drive data sets and visualizations. Applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, correlations, clustering, regression, and principle components etc. Robust scripting and programming skills to perform ETL and data cleansing operations Data-oriented hands on experience using Relational models, Object Models, Hierarchy data models and network data models Medical ontologies, lexicons and tools required Background in computer science, operations research, statistics or a physical engineering discipline. Machine Learning/Predictive Analytics and Mathematical Optimization Development and deployment of healthcare-relevant predictive and prescriptive models with ability to perform standard statistical analysis Core Capabilities  : Understanding of clinical data and data quality needs in ambulatory oncology setting. Work closely with Clinical Data Architect, Senior Data Integration Analyst and stakeholders to build products that will create the Informatics service line. Ability to develop algorithmic approaches to solve clinical/business use cases, triage issues and identifying data anomalies. Computer Skills: Algorithm development in Python and R. Robust SQL query language skills. Experience with Big Data technologies. Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase Proficiency in MS Office Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook required. SSMS, SSRS, Power BI and (No)SQL required. Familiarity with NLP technologies. Data governance knowledge of industry best practice and leading software providers to assist in data steward implementation, maintenance and support. Travel: Standard Core Workdays/Hours (specify weekends and call requirements)  : Monday to Friday 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM. Essential Physical Requirements  : refer to last page of job description for job specific physical and mental requirements.

Do you love the art of using data to solve complex business problems? We do too – and would be excited to have you join our team at Walt Disney World!  Our mission as part of the Commercial Strategy organization is to put our data assets to work, and apply quantitative techniques to discover previously unknown insights about our Guests and business. We get to work directly with the major decision-makers at Disney who shape the Walt Disney World experience. Through our insights, we help form and improve Disney products and offerings.  This is a unique role, in that it looks across a variety of functional areas, and enables the creation of holistic models to better predict and prescribe improvements to the overall Walt Disney World business. A position like this puts you in the middle of the main commercial decisions of the company – and is a great way to showcase your data science skills!  The Senior Analyst – Data Science currently reports to the Lead Data Science and is an individual contributor role.   Responsibilities : While each day will be different, with rotating priorities, the main themes for this role include you being a(n):  Data Wrangler: You understand data and how it supports solving business problems. You will translate the business and analytic needs into data requirements to ensure you have the information you need to solve the problem, and work with technology partners to troubleshoot data quality You will work in a large, complex data environment, compiling and cleansing data across a variety of domains to create a foundation for your analytic work.  Analytics Creator: You leverage data science skills to deliver mathematical models and adhoc statistical analyses. You will conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data collection and exploration, feature generation and reduction, and algorithm selection. You will determine the best techniques to use to solve problems efficiently and effectively, examining all aspects of the analytics curve across statistical, predictive, and prescriptive methods.  Insights Translator: You interpret outputs of analyses and models to make relevant recommendations. You will draw inferences, quantify uncertainty/risk, and identify limitations to accurately summarize your findings, relating them back to the problem at hand. You will successfully craft key takeaways and next steps in the context of business actionability, while facilitating the integration of your work into the decision making process.  Basic Qualifications :  3-5 years of experience in a technical role (analytics, mathematics, software engineering) Knowledge of data science/advanced analytic concepts Experience developing presentations and reports using quantitative information for non-technical stakeholders Proficiency in at least one programming language such as R or Python Advanced knowledge of relational databases and SQL programming Knowledge of industry leading data and analytic tools (e.g., Snowflake, Git, Sagemaker, Dataiku, Tableau) Time-management skills, with ability to prioritize multiple requests and communicate status to partners/leadership  Required Education :  Required Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, mathematics, econometrics)    Preferred Education :  Preference for a Masters
